title: Sydney's biggest ever police operation for New Year's Eve | 7NEWS
description: Sydney will deploy 2,500 police officers for New Year's Eve celebrations, the largest security operation in the city's history. The riot squad will carry long arms in response to recent security concerns following the Bondi incident. Up to one million people are expected at harbour foreshore locations, with extensive transport arrangements including metro services every five minutes until 5am and multiple station closures throughout the evening. title: Florida man crashes Chevrolet Corvette into family home
description: A Florida man driving a Corvette has smashed into a family's home in Palmetto Bay. CCTV shows the family's neighbour at the wheel of the Chevrolet supercar when he loses control and crashes through the garden fence, hitting a boat and the wall of the house. No one was hurt in the accident. #chevrolet #corvette #supercar #florida #floridaman

title: New search launched for missing flight MH370 | 7NEWS
description: Ocean Infinity, an American robotics company, has departed Perth for its third attempt to locate Malaysia Airlines flight MH370, which disappeared in March 2014 with 239 people on board, including six Australians. The search will use autonomous underwater vehicles capable of creating 3D maps of the seabed up to six kilometres below the surface in a remote area of the Indian Ocean where the last satellite ping was detected. The Malaysian government has agreed to pay the company more than $100 million if the missing aircraft is successfully located, with aviation experts believing the black box recording device should still function despite being submerged for over a decade. title: The Y2K millennium bug crisis in Australia | 7NEWS VAULT
description: As midnight approached on December 31, 1999, Australia held its breath. The Y2K "Millennium Bug" threatened to crash computers worldwide, potentially crippling power grids, banks, hospitals, and more.   "We would be like a planet full of blind people," experts warned.  Families were stockpiling water and food, banks were distributing emergency cash, Ansett grounded all flights and the government spent $12 billion to prevent the "catastrophe".  Supermarkets were emptied. Emergency services were on standby. The nation braced for digital doomsday.  And then... nothing happened.  A fascinating time capsule of mass hysteria and the greatest tech scare that never was. title: Stranded Coral Adventurer passengers return home
description: After hitting a coral reef and leaving passengers and staff stranded, the Coral Adventurer cruise liner returns home to Cairns. This was the Coral Adventurer's first voyage since the death of an elderly passenger who was left behind on an island. #coraladventurer #cruise #stranded
